detaileddescription.para: Keep track of previous number of blocks, to detect progress
Set the client model. The client model represents the part of the core that communicates with the P2P network, and is wallet-agnostic.
Get the tray icon status. Some systems have not "system tray" or "notification area" available.
Disconnect core signals from GUI client
Create the main UI actions.
Create the menu bar and sub-menus.
Create the toolbars
Create system tray icon and notification
Create system tray menu (or setup the dock menu)
Enable or disable all wallet-related actions
Connect core signals to GUI client
Update UI with latest network info from model.
Open the OptionsDialog on the specified tab index
Set the proxy-enabled icon as shown in the UI.
Signal raised when a URI was entered or dragged to the GUI
Signal raised when RPC console shown
Set number of connections shown in the UI
Set network state shown in the UI

memberdef.name: setNumBlocks

detaileddescription.para: Set number of blocks and last block date shown in the UI
Launch the wallet creation modal (no-op if wallet is not compiled)

memberdef.argsstring: (const QString &title, QString message, unsigned int style, bool *ret=nullptr, const QString &detailed_message=QString())
memberdef.name: message

detaileddescription.para:
Notify the user of an event from the core network or transaction handling code.
title
the message box / notification title
message
the displayed text
style
modality and style definitions (icon and used buttons - buttons only for message boxes)
CClientUIInterface::MessageBoxFlags
ret
pointer to a bool that will be modified to whether Ok was clicked (modal only)
detailed_message
the text to be displayed in the details area
Show configuration dialog
Show about dialog
Show debug window
Show debug window and set focus to the console
Show help message dialog
Show window if hidden, unminimize when minimized, rise when obscured or show if hidden and fToggleHidden is true
Simply calls showNormalIfMinimized(true)
called by a timer to check if shutdown has been requested
Show progress dialog e.g. for verifychain
Bitcoin GUI main class. This class represents the main window of the Bitcoin UI. It communicates with both the client and wallet models to give the user an up-to-date view of the current core state.
